Title: Source Code
Source_Para1: Flashpoint is powered by free and open-source software. Below you can find a list of projects developed by Flashpoint contributors; more can be found at our $1{GitHub team page}.
Source_Para2: Flashpoint also utilizes the following third-party open-source projects:
CLIFp_Description: A fully-featured command-line launcher for Flashpoint.
Rust_Library_Description: A library for interacting with Flashpoint's database that powers the launcher and the online search tool. Bindings for Node.js can be found $1{here}.
Game_Server_Description: A proxy server that tricks Flashpoint entries into thinking they are running on the live internet.
Launcher_Description: An extensible Electron-based launcher that serves as the primary frontend for the archive.
Manager_Description: A utility for adding, removing, and updating Flashpoint's software components.
Secure_Player_Description: An advanced application that enables playback of plugin-based content without making permanent changes to the Windows registry.
Ultimate_Updater_Description: A utility for upgrading copies of Flashpoint Ultimate.
Website_Description: The very website you're looking at.
FPFSS_Description: The website that handles Flashpoint's curation submission and approval processes.
FPCurator_Description: A tool for managing and automatically generating Flashpoint curations.
Old_CPU_Simulator_Description: A utility that runs applications at simulated clock speeds; used to limit the framerate of games that run too fast on modern computers.
Apache_Description: A web server software used to run older Flashpoint entries that have not yet been made to use the modern Flashpoint Game Server.
Basilisk_Description: A web browser based on pre-Quantum Firefox that supports NPAPI plugins. The version included in Flashpoint is rebranded to $1{Flashpoint Navigator} due to licensing restrictions; its repository can be found $2{here}.
Chromium_Description: A modern web browser developed by Google, capable of running more recent and resource-heavy HTML5 content.
MediaWiki_Description: The software used to power the Flashpoint Wiki.
PHP_Description: A web scripting language used by numerous games in Flashpoint.
Name: Name
